Dear BREANNA NELSON:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
September 12, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan
department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial
agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides,
that the person has not been determined
to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child
2

neglect. The documentation shall be
completed not more than 30 days prior to
the start of employment and every 12
months thereafter.
One of six new employee files reviewed did not have a central registry clearance
completed within 30 days prior to hire date. The clearance was completed on
2/26/24, but the employee was not hired until 4/15/24.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• If a youth leaves the facility, it is considered a youth discharge under the
facility license, even if the youth maintains the same case manager or is
still open under another program through Samaritas. A discharge plan must
be completed.
• Discharge plan information was in two different areas. It is recommended
the facility complete one summary form to ensure all information is in one
place.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require or request any consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility had one CAP during the period of review as a result of their 2023
Renewal inspection. The facility received violations regarding dental care and
Social Services Worker Qualifications. To rectify the dental care violation, the
facility put in procedures regarding caseworkers scheduling appointments well in
advance, and supervisor following up during supervision. In addition, the supervisor
was responsible for verifying the initial appointment date on the initial placement
checklist. To rectify the social services worker qualifications violation, the facility
wrote a variance, which was approved by DCWL. In addition, the facility put in a
procedure that the program manager and HR Business Partner had to verify any
hires to ensure they qualified for their positions per licensing rules, prior to the
candidate being hired.
3

Financial Overview
The facility's financial budget and financial audit were reviewed, and there were no
concerns noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) noted all dentals have been completed timely since the
implementation of the CAP from the 2023 renewal inspection. She stated
implementing the plan to have workers schedule the initial dental exams at the
same time they schedule the initial medical exams has been instrumental in
achieving timeliness. She also noted that there have been no further issues with
hiring someone for a social services worker position who didn't meet the
requirements. CA noted it continues to be a challenge to identify a social services
worker who meet the educational qualifications, and also work in the facility's
service area. CA noted they have been seeking a replacement for the current social
services worker, as the employee is supposed to transfer to another role within
Samaritas but won't transfer until a replacement is found.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed at the facility on 9/12/24. Staff reported they felt supported at
the facility, and that the facility was one of the best employers they've ever had.
They reported they felt there was open communication and could speak up if they
ever had any concerns. No one had any concerns during interviews.
Youth were interviewed at the facility on 9/12/24. Youth reported they felt safe at
the facility, were treated well by staff, did not have any concerns, were receiving
enough food, liked the food provided, and felt they had staff they could talk to if
they ever had any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility occurred on 9/12/24, and there were no concerns
noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
